00021     : optimalThreshold_(0), backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_(255),

00033 const unsigned char &Preprocessor::computeOptimalThreshold (const Clip &clip, const unsigned int &technique)
00034 {
00035     if ( technique == 0 )
00036         computeSonkaOptimalThreshold (clip);
00037     else
00038         computeOtsuOptimalThreshold (clip);
00039     
00040     return optimalThreshold_;
00041 };

00053 const unsigned char &Preprocessor::findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel (const Clip &clip, const unsigned int &referenceGrayLevelNeighbours)
00054 {
00055     // Start timing
00056     boost::timer timer;
00057     timer.restart();
00058     
00059     
00060     // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00061     std::vector<unsigned char> pixels = clip.pixels();
00062     
00063     
00064     // Compute clip histogram
00065     std::vector<unsigned int> histogram(256, 0);
00066     std::vector<unsigned char>::iterator pixelsIterator;
00067     
00068     for ( pixelsIterator = pixels.begin(); pixelsIterator not_eq pixels.end(); ++pixelsIterator )
00069         histogram[static_cast<unsigned int>(*pixelsIterator)] += 1;
00070     
00071         
00072     // Search the more frequent level of gray
00073     std::vector<unsigned int>::iterator histogramIterator;
00074     unsigned int moreFrequentGrayLevel = 0;
00075     unsigned int maximumAppearances = histogram[0];
00076     
00077     for ( unsigned int l = 1; l < 256; ++l )
00078     {
00079         if ( histogram[l] > maximumAppearances )
00080         {
00081             moreFrequentGrayLevel   = l;
00082             maximumAppearances      = histogram[l];
00083         }
00084     }
00085     unsigned int referenceGrayLevel = moreFrequentGrayLevel * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00086 
00087 
00088     // Search the neighbours of the more frequent level of gray
00089     std::vector<unsigned int>::reverse_iterator histogramReverseIterator( std::find (histogram.rbegin(), histogram.rend(), histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel])++ );
00090     histogramIterator = histogramReverseIterator.base()++;
00091     unsigned int nFrequencies = histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00092 
00093     for ( unsigned int i = 1; i <= referenceGrayLevelNeighbours; ++i )
00094     {
00095         // Search forwards
00096         if ( histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end() )
00097         {
00098             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel + i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00099             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00100 
00101             ++histogramIterator;
00102         }
00103 
00104         // Search backwards
00105         if ( histogramReverseIterator not_eq histogram.rend() )
00106         {
00107             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel - i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00108             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00109 
00110             ++histogramReverseIterator;
00111         }
00112     }
00113 
00114     // Set the background reference gray level found
00115     backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = static_cast<unsigned char>( round(referenceGrayLevel / nFrequencies) );
00116     
00117     // Gather elapsed time
00118     backgroundReferenceGrayLevelFindingTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00119 
00120     return backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00121 };

00129 void Preprocessor::removeIsolatedNoise (Clip &clip, const unsigned int &isolationCoefficient)
00130 {
00131     // Start timing
00132     boost::timer timer;
00133     timer.restart();
00134     
00135     
00136     // Loop over the clip to remove every noisy isolated pixel
00137     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00138     {
00139         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00140         {
00141             unsigned char pixelGrayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(i, j);
00142             
00143             // Comparison values to avoid pixels that clearly belong to the background
00144             bool backgroundPixelOnWhite = (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ > optimalThreshold_) and (pixelGrayLevel >= backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00145             bool backgroundPixelOnBlack = (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (pixelGrayLevel <= backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00146             
00147             if ( not backgroundPixelOnBlack and not backgroundPixelOnWhite )
00148             {
00149                 unsigned int nBackgroundPixels = 0, nPixels = 0;
00150 
00151                 // Explore the pixel neighbourhood
00152                 for(int p = i-1; p < static_cast<int>(i+2); p++)
00153                 {
00154                     for(int q = j-1; q < static_cast<int>(j+2); q++)
00155                     {
00156                         // Comparison values to avoid step outside the image and the central pixel
00157                         bool heightOverflow = (p < 0) or (p >= static_cast<int>(clip.height()));
00158                         bool widthOverflow  = (q < 0) or (q >= static_cast<int>(clip.width()));
00159                         bool isCentralPixel = (p == static_cast<int>(i)) and (q == static_cast<int>(j));
00160                         
00161                         if ( not heightOverflow and not widthOverflow and not isCentralPixel )
00162                         {
00163                             // Update pixels counter
00164                             nPixels++;
00165 
00166                             // Get neighbour pixel gray level
00167                             unsigned char neighbourPixelGrayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(p, q);
00168 
00169                             // When background gray level is close to white but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00170                             if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ >= optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel >= optimalThreshold_) )
00171                                 nBackgroundPixels++;
00172                             else
00173                             {
00174                                 // When background gray level is close to black but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00175                                 if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel <= optimalThreshold_) )
00176                                     nBackgroundPixels++;
00177                             }
00178                         }
00179                     }
00180                 }
00181 
00182                 // Clear the noisy pixel if it is isolated
00183                 if (nBackgroundPixels >= (nPixels - isolationCoefficient))
00184                     clip.setPixelGrayLevel(i, j, backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00185             }
00186         }
00187     }
00188     
00189     // Gather elapsed time
00190     noiseRemovalTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00191 };

00199 void Preprocessor::computeSonkaOptimalThreshold (const Clip &clip)
00200 {
00201     // Start timing
00202     boost::timer timer;
00203     timer.restart();
00204     
00205     // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00206     std::vector<unsigned char> pixels = clip.pixels();
00207     
00208     
00209     // Start with an initial threshold
00210     optimalThreshold_ = backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00211     unsigned char currentThreshold = ~optimalThreshold_;    // Enforces current threshold to be different so the firts loop is always made
00212     
00213     
00214     // Loop as many times as needed to find the optimal threshold by averaging the pixel gray levels
00215     while (currentThreshold not_eq optimalThreshold_)
00216     {
00217         double backgroundMeanValue = 0, objectsMeanValue = 0;
00218         unsigned int nSamples = 0;
00219         
00220         std::vector<unsigned char>::iterator pixelsIterator;
00221         
00222         // Compute the background and objects mean values
00223         for ( pixelsIterator = pixels.begin(); pixelsIterator not_eq pixels.end(); ++pixelsIterator )
00224         {
00225             unsigned char grayLevel = *pixelsIterator;
00226             
00227             if ( grayLevel >= optimalThreshold_ )
00228             {
00229                 backgroundMeanValue += static_cast<double>(grayLevel);
00230                 nSamples++;
00231             }
00232             else
00233                 objectsMeanValue += static_cast<double>(grayLevel);
00234         }
00235         backgroundMeanValue = round(backgroundMeanValue / static_cast<double>(nSamples));
00236         objectsMeanValue = round(objectsMeanValue / static_cast<double>(clip.nPixels() - nSamples));
00237 
00238 
00239         // Update the optimal threshold keeping the last one
00240         currentThreshold = optimalThreshold_;
00241         optimalThreshold_ = static_cast<unsigned char>( round((objectsMeanValue + backgroundMeanValue) / 2.0) );
00242     }
00243     
00244     // Gather elapsed time
00245     optimalThresholdComputingTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00246 };

00248 
00256 void Preprocessor::computeOtsuOptimalThreshold (const Clip &clip)
00257 {
00258     // Start timing
00259     boost::timer timer;
00260     timer.restart();
00261     
00262     // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00263     std::vector<unsigned char> pixels   = clip.pixels();
00264     
00265     
00269     std::vector<double> histogram(256,0.0);
00270     std::vector<unsigned char>::iterator pixelsIterator;
00271     
00272     for ( pixelsIterator = pixels.begin(); pixelsIterator not_eq pixels.end(); ++pixelsIterator )
00273         histogram[static_cast<int>(*pixelsIterator)] += 1.0;
00274     
00275     double nPixels = static_cast<double>( clip.nPixels() );
00276     std::transform (histogram.begin(), histogram.end(), histogram.begin(), std::bind2nd(std::divides<double>(), nPixels) );
00277     
00278     
00282     double meanGrayLevel = 0.0;
00283     for ( unsigned int k = 1; k <= 256; ++k )
00284         meanGrayLevel += histogram[k-1] * static_cast<double>(k);
00285         
00286     
00291     std::vector<double> omega(256,0.0);
00292     std::vector<double> mu(256,0.0);
00293     for ( unsigned int k = 0; k < 256; ++k )
00294     {
00295         for ( unsigned int i = 0; i <= k; ++i )
00296         {
00297             omega[k]    += histogram[i];
00298             mu[k]       += histogram[i] * static_cast<double>(i+1) ;
00299         }
00300     }
00301     
00302     
00306     std::vector<double> sigma(256,0.0);
00307     for ( unsigned int k = 0; k < 256; ++k )
00308     {
00309         double numerator    = (meanGrayLevel * omega[k]) - mu[k];
00310         double denominator  = omega[k] - (1.0 - omega[k]);
00311         
00312         sigma[k] = pow(numerator, 2) / denominator;
00313     }
00314     
00315     
00319     optimalThreshold_ = 0;
00320     double maximumSigma = sigma[0];
00321     for ( unsigned int k = 1; k < 256; ++k )
00322     {
00323         if ( sigma[k] > maximumSigma )
00324         {
00325             maximumSigma        = sigma[k];
00326             optimalThreshold_   = static_cast<unsigned char>(k);
00327         }
00328     }
00329     
00330     // Gather elapsed time
00331     optimalThresholdComputingTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00332 };
00333 
00334 // ///
00335 // /// @details To compute the optimal threshold following an adaptive strategy we divided the clip into <em>n</em> subclips and apply the Sonka's method
00336 // /// over them. Thus, a list of threshold values are returned, one for each subimage, that allows a thresholding technique to be more accurate.
00337 // ///
00338 // unsigned int Preprocessor::computeOptimalAdaptiveThreshold (const Clip &clip, std::vector<unsigned char> &thresholds)
00339 // {
00340 //  // Stablish the side's size of the subimages
00341 //  const unsigned int subclipSide  = 100;
00342 // 
00343 //  // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00344 //  std::vector<unsigned char> pixels = clip.pixels();
00345 //  
00346 //  // Empty output vector
00347 //  thresholds.clear();
00348 //  
00349 //  // Explore subimages
00350 //  for ( unsigned int row = 0; row < ceil(static_cast<double>(clip.height()) / static_cast<double>(subclipSide)) ; ++row )
00351 //  {
00352 //      for ( unsigned int column = 0; column < ceil(static_cast<double>(clip.width()) / static_cast<double>(subclipSide)) ; ++column )
00353 //      {
00354 //          // Start with an initial threshold
00355 //          unsigned char optimalThreshold = backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00356 //          unsigned char currentThreshold = ~optimalThreshold; // Enforces current threshold to be different so the firts loop is always made
00357 // 
00358 //          // Loop as many times as needed to find the optimal threshold by averaging the pixel gray levels
00359 //          while (currentThreshold not_eq optimalThreshold)
00360 //          {
00361 //              double backgroundMeanValue = 0, objectsMeanValue = 0;
00362 //              unsigned int nSamples = 0;
00363 // 
00364 //              for ( unsigned int i = row * subclipSide; (i < ((row * subclipSide) + subclipSide)) and (i < clip.height()); ++i )
00365 //              {
00366 //                  for ( unsigned int j = column * subclipSide; (j < ((column * subclipSide) + subclipSide)) and (j < clip.width()); ++j )
00367 //                  {
00368 //                      unsigned char grayLevel = pixels[i * clip.width() + j];
00369 // 
00370 //                      if ( grayLevel >= optimalThreshold )
00371 //                      {
00372 //                          backgroundMeanValue += static_cast<double>(grayLevel);
00373 //                          nSamples++;
00374 //                      }
00375 //                      else
00376 //                          objectsMeanValue += static_cast<double>(grayLevel);
00377 //                  }
00378 //              }
00379 // 
00380 //              backgroundMeanValue = round(backgroundMeanValue / static_cast<double>(nSamples));
00381 //              objectsMeanValue = round(objectsMeanValue / static_cast<double>(clip.nPixels() - nSamples));
00382 // 
00383 // 
00384 //              // Update the optimal threshold keeping the last one
00385 //              currentThreshold = optimalThreshold;
00386 //              optimalThreshold = static_cast<unsigned char>( round((objectsMeanValue + backgroundMeanValue) / 2.0) );
00387 //          }
00388 //          thresholds.push_back(optimalThreshold);
00389 //      }
00390 //  }
00391 // 
00392 //  return thresholds.size();
00393 // };
